website_summaries.verdict: An exceedingly popular pair of grooming gloves that blows away the competition when it comes to quality and value.
pros: Collects an incredible amount of fur for de-shedding
Comes with an adjustable wrist strap
Most animals enjoy the feel of the gentle massage
Comes with left and right gloves
cons: Hair can be difficult to get off glove
Does not work as well for short-haired breed as it does for the long-haired

customer_reviews.title: Not for short haired dog hair.
customer_reviews.text: I’m editing my review. I originally gave this product only 3 stars since it did not work for my particular dog. The retailer promptly contacted me and offered a full refund/help resolve any issue. I appreciate the quick customer service. To be clear I have a small Rat terrier/ Chihuahua mix. He has short straight hair. My dog certainly enjoys the massage he gets from the gloves. While it grabbed some hair, the hair did not stick to the gloves as well as it does with longer haired dogs. To provide some insight to everyone that is curious about how this would work on their short haired dogs.
customer_reviews.author: ckron

customer_reviews.title: Terrible gloves! Don't work to take ANY hair off dog, AND are too small
customer_reviews.text: These lousy gloves are too small for a normal size hand, AND they DONT WORK. After a number of "brushings" of my black lab, there was NO hair removed. THEN upon trying to send them back for a refund, I'm told they do not qualify for a refund! WHAT? I'm disgusted at both this company and Amazon. Do not buy them.
customer_reviews.author: John Edward Martin

customer_reviews.title: My puppy is 11 months old and sheds like crazy. The gloves are perfect because my puppy ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work wonders for my long-haired German Shepherd puppy. My puppy is 11 months old and sheds like crazy. The gloves are perfect because my puppy does not like being brushed by those rough brushes and tries to bite them. With the gloves she doesn't care as much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Marketing gimmick!
customer_reviews.text: Marketing gimmick. Not sure how they show the matted hair so easily pulling away from these gloves in the video images. The reality is that it creates a hot mess of hair that extremely hard to remove from the glove tongs.Total wastee of money.
customer_reviews.author: GailM

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't grab the hair well enough.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 white German Shepherds with thick double coats typical of the breed. I call them the "Shedmeisters." They shed their hair copiously year round. I thought that these would be perfect because they love being petted, but hate being brushed. I was disappointed because these gloves do not pick up much hair at all. I actually get more hair off of them with my bare hands. I think that the grooming tines are too short. I do not recommend these. Maybe they work for some breeds, but not for my German Shepherds.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected but needs a redesign
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it and it definitely works. Removal of the hair from the gloves is less difficult the more hair is on it. My biggest complaint is that the black material the rest of the glove is made from holds on to hair and it does not come off so the gloves remain messy and drop hair even after the blue silicon nubs have been cleaned off. I have to store it in a bag after use. That black material should be changed to a smooth material that does not hold on to hair.
customer_reviews.author: Donna P.

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing product for shedding and non shedding dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product for shedding and non shedding dogs!! We got 2 Golden Doodles, litter mates, and it's very funny that one got the shedding fur of the Golden Retriever, and the other got the hypoallergenic non shedding fur of the Doodle. These gloves did a wonderful job at helping us groom both the dogs!!! And to remove the hair from the glove, all I did was run my hand backwards (from fingers to wrist) a few times which really did a great job! I'm totally recommending this to my friends!!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works, but only came in Medium
customer_reviews.text: They work well. Only came in a medium, a bit too big for me. My cat was able to grab and pull off my hand even with wrist strap all the way closed.
customer_reviews.author: Trisueh

customer_reviews.title: Did not work at all like advertised in the video clips
customer_reviews.text: It did not work at all on my Aussies. For the effort of rubbing my dogs with this glove, I'd rather use the effort then to just brush them with a regular dog undercoat brush. Did not work at all like advertised in the video clips. I should have known that a simple glove with bristles couldn't be anywhere as effective as a undercoat brush, or even just normal dog brush. That's how bad it was on my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Williams

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome - thinking of buying more!
customer_reviews.text: I just tried these for the first time on my cat who absolutely hates being brushed. She loved these! She thought she was being scratched, not brushed. The gloves also did a great job of picking up stay hairs and they were pretty easy to clean. I didn’t wet the gloves before using, as recommended, but they still did a good job of getting stray hairs and they were mostly easy to clean. My only complaint is that they don’t come in sizes. Because I have small hands and don’t fill out the gloves I don’t think I get their maximum potential. Even so, I’m still thinking of ordering a pair for my boyfriend to use with his cat.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: I Want to go back in time and invent this brush.
customer_reviews.text: I can not give this product enough stars! I have a super lazy, chubby cat, and since I’ve used this brush, her coat is so shiny and soft. I’ve brushed her for two days straight now and I have pulled SOOO much undercoat and dandruff off her skin. And the best part is she freaking loves it. And she’s not a particularly affectionate cat, but she has been ever since these gloves! Easy to clean, made sturdy, adjustable wrists...just buy them. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they did a poor job of collecting hair on my black lab and ...
customer_reviews.text: they did a poor job of collecting hair on my black lab and it is difficult to get what little hair they do collect off of the gloves. all in all, a complete waste of money and time. I much prefer my grooming brush with sharp teeth that are very close together.
customer_reviews.author: Matteo Tucker

customer_reviews.title: HAIR INCLUDED!
customer_reviews.text: Literally arrived with animal hair already on them. I believe I bought them used but come on? Couldn’t even clean it?
customer_reviews.author: luckyrabbit

customer_reviews.title: These gloves work!
customer_reviews.text: These pet grooming gloves are great! I have a Staffordshire Bull Terrier and his hair is short. Some of the reviews I read said the gloves don’t work very good on short hair dogs. I beg to differ. Not only do they remove a lot of excess hair they massage my dog at the same time. I find I only have to use them a couple times a week. When I put these on, my dog will come right over for his massage/grooming. So glad I purchased the gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my older dog
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically because I saw a review about how well these worked on someone's older arthritic dog. My pup is a short-haired lab mix with a very thick undercoat who is in a constant state of shedding. She has arthritis in her back and the hard metal brushes are too spiky. Unfortunately, these gloves were no better. While the nubs are softer, in order to actually get to her undercoat I had to apply a painful amount of pressure, which completely defeats the purpose. I am guessing these work better for cats. I am disappointed that these did not work, because I loved the idea of giving my pup some love, while also getting rid of some fur.
customer_reviews.author: Zoetilda

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Gloves of Purfect Pets!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat won't stop following me around! He knows I possess the Mighty Gloves of Perfect Pets and only I can wield their magic powers! But seriously my cat is a wimp, a wuss. New things freak him out but after a few slow attempts, he gave into the temptation. Does it help with shedding? Watch the video.
customer_reviews.author: Alley!!!!

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me but seller made it right
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed by these. Sure, they collect some hair - but so do all my pants... I have two golden retrievers. An actual de-shedding brush works FAR better than these gloves. Don't waste your money. -- REVIEW UPDATE: After posting the above complaint about the product, I was immediately contacted by the seller and given a full refund. They mentioned that the gloves work better on some hair types than others - my dogs have rather flat, silky hair. So perhaps this is why the gloves didn't work as well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Haley S.

customer_reviews.title: Keep on looking for something that works better.
customer_reviews.text: This item does collect the hair but trying to get the hair off of the gloves is a real chore unless you have a vacuum hose ready to vacuum it off. Keep on looking for something that works better.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These do a nice job of cleaning our always shedding cat and she ...
customer_reviews.text: These do a nice job of cleaning our always shedding cat and she got used to the process easily. We dehair her once a week but have found the stitching on the thumb side tearing out. That part is our only real gripe. Guess I'll have to get the sewing kit out. Boo. After I posted the above review, the folks at Delomo reached out to me and generously offered to refund the purchase price and let me keep the gloves. Makes sewing a lot easier. I appreciate their attention to their customers concerns. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pfahler

customer_reviews.title: RIP OFF
customer_reviews.text: This item does not work. It states it is for all types of hair - cat, dog, etc. My dog sheds like crazy, these gloves did nothing but give her a nice little massage. It barely took any of her shedding hair, hardly any hair was in the actual glove section. I wanted to return them, shocker, they do not accept returns. Do NOT buy these, they are a rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Sears

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: Tried the gloves on my golden retriever who sheds everywhere! Didn't pick up the hair. Maybe a few strands. Also, the hair did not come off the glove as easy as they say. It took more effort and getting the hair off of a brush. Going to stick with my brush for my dog and cats.
customer_reviews.author: John Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Two gloves are better than one!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the massaging and de-shedding glove, but it only was the right hand. It works, but I thought about left handed people, and remember hearing about the right-left combo. Three minutes on Amazon, and there they were. Much more soothing, and removes matting and debris like magic! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: D. MCDONALDTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Should have bough long ago!
customer_reviews.text: I have a large short hair rescue pit bull and a short hair lab pit mix from the pound. I put these gloves on and they immediately come over to get groomed, they can not get enough, just lightly stroke and they are in heaven and do not want to move. I had no idea this would make their day so much. I don't think there is a cheaper investment in your dogs happiness. Also, I am a 6ft tall guy with size large hands and these one size fit all, do fit me just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Lesser quality of earlier purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this “upgraded” product. It’s not. This is my second purchase which is smaller, lighter in weight, shorter “teeth” and not sewn as sturdy as my Purchase of 6 months ago. I wore out the first mitt with two dogs and machine washing. Too bad an initial excellent product is now cheaper quality, different packaging, obviously lesser vendor. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: taswell

customer_reviews.title: Worthless and I have a husky
customer_reviews.text: So, I got these because I have a Siberian husky (lots of hair) and she doesn't like to hold still to be brushed so I figured I could walk and brush her with these gloves easier than fighting with the brush. While they are easy to use, they are absolutely worthless for getting the hair off a dog. My deshedding brush makes it look like I dumped a pillow out. These things barely get any hair off if her. Total waste of time and money 😵
customer_reviews.author: Elmer

customer_reviews.title: Needs to come in a small size
customer_reviews.text: I saw so many great reviews on these & similar gloves but I have small hands & as I use them they turn, flop & don't fit well at all. The velcro closure is a great addition as it keeps the glove from sliding off of my hand completely. Just wish they came in a smaller size for women with small hands. Otherwise they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Happy woman

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd go ahead and try these even though reviews weren't all that great- Apparently my cats don't care for the feel of these AT ALL, but when I did get them to deal for a minute the gloves kinda just sucked- they just redistributed fur rather than grabbing & removing it, and what fur was caught on the teeth wouldn't come off even when cleaned with a brush.
customer_reviews.author: Mayflyaway

customer_reviews.title: How do I get a refund!  Worse ever
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it zero I would! Does nothing like I saw on the video. You have to pet very hard, my dogs won’t sit through it she runs when seen. The hair is hard to get off the gloves totally not worth the effort and time using this product. If this an upgraded Than what did the old one do? I think the spikes need to be longer to grab the fur, it barely grabs anything.
customer_reviews.author: francesca sierra

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great but they scare my cat
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my cat hates brushes. She'll just attack it if she sees one. These gloves are easy to put on, they work well, and it's pretty easy to get the fur off. However, my cat HATES them. If she isn't looking when I put them on and doesn't see me when I start petting her, she doesn't mind. But if she sees them? She will fight with all the power in her 12 pound body. It's like I brought a monster into the house. So I guess they don't feel bad, but visually they scare her.
customer_reviews.author: TessaL

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Used on my cat. Had used a similar glove in past that wore out. Needed to replace. Previous glove worked great. This one not so much. This glove when brush cat scatters cat hair everywhere but in the glove. Goes on floor and into air. Not even into a nice bundle. Just scatters. I purchased another glove just before this one. The hair does not stick on glove but it does a great job of bundling the cat hair. I suppose I will keep that one. I am disappointed in this one because I had one in past and it worked great in the past
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Alba

customer_reviews.title: These are the cats meow!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this thing it was like an infomercial in my house. I couldn't believe it, and I had to tell everyone...seriously! Never have I ever seen this picky cat like to be brushed or touched so much. She even prances around like a new cat every time I'm finished. This glove catches all of the loose fur, and it's so easy to pull it right off. Just brushing over a few times makes such a huge difference. This helps so much with eliminating hairballs. I'm so happy I found these, and I'll speak for my cat when I say she is too.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Kiwi

customer_reviews.title: My cats love to be brushed with these gloves!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a second pair of these for my daughter to use on her cats. I have been using them for a while now, and they work wonderfully! They really grab a lot of fur and help to keep it from flying around or collecting on floors. I bought a pair of similar gloves for my daughter from a different organization that costs much more and took weeks to receive. They were horrible and such a lower-grade product. So, I came back to these and ordered another pair for her to use. These are truly great...my cats have come to look forward to each time I get these out!
customer_reviews.author: CAW

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. The dogs aren't thrilling on it, but the cat loves it. Did I say loves it? She runs to me when I get it out. She will lay on her back so I can massage her tummy. She jumps up to rub her back on the glove on my hand. Its that time of year and the hair just flies around her. This picks enough hair up that I don't see hair clumps around on the floor. Love it. Looking at the amazon site, I see they have pink too. Darn wish I'd seen that! Saves me a lot of vacuuming. Hair isn't flying around when she walks by. I think its great!
customer_reviews.author: P. L. Gerleman

customer_reviews.title: She asks me why.  Why is there hair (fur) everywhere?  You should get these mitts and do the cats/dogs a favor!
customer_reviews.text: OMG. Two cats are in seventh heaven once we laid these cool mitts on them! Talk about fur removal. And easy to clean up as well as the fur sticks to the mitt for easy peel off into the trash. Wham! Bam! purr purr purr! Here kitties! give me a head with hair, long beautiful hair Shining, gleaming, steaming, flaxen, waxen Give me down to there hair, shoulder length or longer clogging up my vacuum Here, baby, there, momma, everywhere, daddy, daddy atchoo atchoo! Hair, hair, hair, hair, hair, hair, hair, hair everywhere and then some! Flow it, show it, long as God can grow it,now I can clean it up with these lovely mitts. My apologies to the Cowsills.....
customer_reviews.author: DeepDishorThin

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: So I love these gloves. The cats and dog don’t mind being simply pet with these on. They trap hair very nicely. Only downfall is removing the hair. I tried rubbing my hands together and using water which did NOT work. Ultimately what worked for me was using the hose on a vacuum to suck the hair off which isn’t a problem. But it sucks to have to turn on the vacuum every few strokes to clean the hair off so I can see progress. Otherwise these are very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Keefe

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Efficient
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to brush the cat fur while the cat was sitting on my lap. The advertising made it look like this was a great tool. Unfortunately, these gloves just don't pick up the cat fur - they are stiff and the bristles are hard, and the fur just doesn't stick to the bristles very well. Since they just don't do very well what they are advertised to do, two stars is the best I can do. I would NOT buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: UmpJJ

customer_reviews.title: My cats love the gloves
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had purchased these years ago. I have 3 cats and walk through clouds of hair even right after dry mopping or vacuuming. These work like a charm. My big boy with long beautiful hair purrs when he sees me putting them on. His coat is shiny and little hair floats around the house now. Just ordered a pair for a daughter who has 4 cats. Very pleased with my purchase and I know she will like using them on her pack.
customer_reviews.author: judithh

customer_reviews.title: Very Stiff
customer_reviews.text: My hope was that these would be less terrifying to my spookable cat. The thick rubber slab that made it difficult to move my fingers and thumb had her shooting off my lap in less than three seconds. While It is possible the problem is in my ignorance, these "gloves" are far worse than a grooming comb. I lose all dexterity and can no longer get into any of the narrow places she matts so badly. For me they are a total bust.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sackinger

customer_reviews.title: Very large on my small hands but works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: My hands are very small so the gloves slip around which makes them a little difficult to get a proper grip, but the overall experience is good. We have a shepherd mix who sheds like there's no tomorrow. We have a furminator but he HATES being brushed which means a session won't last more than 5 minutes. With the gloves he thinks he's just getting a very vigorous scratch session and LOVES it. He'll roll over and beg for you to rub his belly with the gloves and it's made the whole experience of deshedding much easier
customer_reviews.author: collegestudent

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product. I really did. But it just doesn’t make the cut a brush like the furminator or a pet fur comb both work a lot better, and frankly, using a bare hand gets as much fur off as this glove. It may work on dogs; I don’t know. But I will say that it doesn’t really do very well on cats or on rabbits: I tried it on two of each. It doesn’t even work all that well for gathering up rabbit fur when it’s already in piles on the carpet (from brushing). I wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: My Black Lab loves them
customer_reviews.text: My black lab has the typical lab skin problems, Flaky/itchy skin that can easily lead to a skin yeast infection if she doesn't get bathed frequently, especially in the hot, humid summers of the southeast. Per our vet's suggestion, I ordered these gloves for he bathing to get her medicated shampoo down to her skin easier. Our lab loves baths so much now. She starts jumping up and down when we pull out the gloves from the pet cabinet, and she's elderly - 12 yo, but you'd never know except that grey on her chin and on her paws. I love these gloves and they are Millie May approved.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Or Tracy Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: An excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim because my cat sheds a lot (DSH Tabby). He absolutely hates brushes and combs, and though he's generally pretty chill, brushing him is about the only instance he'll try biting you. But this glove he actually enjoys a lot. I'm not sure if it's because of the silicon bristles or because he feels like hes being petted versus brushed. Regardless he will lay down in front of me and let me use this on him. I actually recommend this (and have to a majority of my friends after testing it out for a week), especially if your pet doesn't like combs or brushes but needs to be groomed.
customer_reviews.author: Count von Kit

customer_reviews.title: Best Item Ever !
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love them and they do a great job ! Will buy again, if these ever wear out. Would recommend magnets for wristbands instead of Velcro as an option. I expect cat hair in the hook side will be an issue years from now. But, that is definitely NOT a design flaw. Just the reality of cat hair. 🤣 Thank you for making grooming easier for someone who has a hard time holding brushes some days. Plus, these remove way more hair per brushing and are crazy easy to clean if you follow instructions and lightly mist with water first. That is a must, so keep a spray bottle close. (A plant mister would be better, tbh.)
customer_reviews.author: rqh

customer_reviews.title: I got a full refund from the seller
customer_reviews.text: I have a Persian cat with so much hair, I just didn't know what to do. I got this item but I could not get it to work for me. The comb I purchased at the same time just seemed to be better for this cat. I think it was very kind of the seller to refund the price of the gloves after such a long time having it, and it was not returned. Very kind of them. I think this will probably work on a shorter hair cat. Thank you again for listening to my review.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Llewellyn

customer_reviews.title: What more could you want?
customer_reviews.text: This is the third dog mitt I have purchased and by far the best to date. Easier to clean and takes more hair off then the previous one I had. Its fantastic because the price is better too. And again - there are TWO of them! What more could you want? I have a long haired Aussie that really doesn't shed that I brush first and then follow with the gloves just because he really likes it. My short haired Aussie sheds like a cat and the mitt was originally for him. These mitts do wonders at how much it pulls from him and he loves it. He comes and waits his turn when brush time comes.
customer_reviews.author: DiJeay

customer_reviews.title: Really work well, good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical when I saw the initial ad for these. I figured most likely my cats would whip around and sink their teeth into my hand but they LOVE these gloves. Purr up a storm and angle their bodies so I can pet them even more. And day one I removed easily an entire extra cat's worth of fur off my fat cat. The thick fur mats peel right off, for lighter ones I used a tape roller to get loose. Cat A gets jealous and mad if he smells Cat B on the gloves so I reserve one glove exclusively for each. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JB123

customer_reviews.title: So much more than the best grooming tool you'll ever have!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are AMAZING! My doggy just melted into a puddle of pure happiness and contentment. It's like a massage for him. With the gloves I can get all areas SO EASILY that were difficult with a brush. Flip him on his back (his tongue hanging out and probably some drool as he's lost all control of his body) and get his legs and belly and all the hard to reach areas. It's a wonderful bonding time. It feels so good to be able to do something for Charlie after all the things he does got me.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Wish I’d tried this glove sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly my long haired cat, who can be pretty difficult, seemed to really enjoy the stroking with the glove. Got a lot of loose fur off her without it stressing her. She tolerates a comb for very brief periods and then gets nippy. With this glove she just laid there while I stroked her with it. It wasn't that hard to get the fur off the glove once I got the edges started. All in all, I’m a fan.
customer_reviews.author: CathieQ

customer_reviews.title: We're very pleased
customer_reviews.text: We have a Garfield and he loves being pampered with this gloves. To him we're just petting him, and to us we're solving the shedding problem in our house. It's fairly easy to remove the hair form the gloves after if you pull them off in the opposite direction than you where stroking. The gloves fit large on me, but it's not uncomfortable to use them. They fit snugly on my husband and he has no trouble either. Even my 2 kids (7-3) use them with no trouble. After seeing my gloves my sister bought some to use with her cocker spaniel and they have worked great for them too.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. S.

customer_reviews.title: Keep brushing them with these!
customer_reviews.text: You will be amazed if you stick with it. Our cats LOVE these, though it took a bit to make them understand, so stick with it. The amount of hair which is on the glove is seriously astonishing! We can do it multiple times a day to each cat and it would still be a whole glove full! We like having two gloves available, but typically have found it works better to only wear one. You can soothe and gently hold the animal with your non-gloved hand and brush with the other hand wearing the glove. It's so satisfying to peel off the sheet of hair after a good brushing session!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok...but not any better than a traditional brush.
customer_reviews.text: The main plus to these gloves is the fact that your pet treats them like you are petting them. However, they are NOT as easy to clean as advertised. I used the gloves on 2 dogs with 2 completely different hair types. They work best with short course hair. The bristles were not long enough to get to the inner layer on the dog with a dual coat. During the summer, it's the fine thin inner layer that sheds on that dog so I need a brush with long enough teeth to get to that inner layer without scratching the dog's skin. With the dual coat, the gloves did not perform as well a traditional wire brush.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya

customer_reviews.title: They only remove a bit of loose hair
customer_reviews.text: Although the gloves do remove some very surface layer hair, I don’t recommend these gloves if you are trying to reduce your dog’s shedding. I am allergic to one of my pups, so I thought this might be a good option, but it only removes a small amount of hair at a time, and I still have to pull the hair out of the teeth of the gloves too.
customer_reviews.author: paintergirl70

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately, my medium – long haired feline friend hates this product
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, my medium – long haired feline friend hates this product. I was so excited to reads about this cool invention, but after only 30 seconds of gently stroking whilst wearing these mitts my cat’s tail begins to flicker nervously, then she starts to growly in agitation. Also, and most notably these mittens do not comb off as much hair, not cleans as easily as advertised. Hair remains stuck between the rubber spikes. Silly me, I bought, not one but two pairs, both seems to have been a waste of money for me so far. Then again, maybe it’s just my cats who’s picky. I dunno!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that these would work. I have two long hair cats, and copious amounts of cat hair on my comforter no matter what I do. These work great for getting cat hair off of furniture and fabric. They also work great to get excess hair off of your cat. My cats both love these! That is saying A LOT because one of my cats won't let us brush her whatsoever. Great product for a cat friendly home!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany S

customer_reviews.title: Your dog will love this product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girlfriend. Her dog (70 lbs Flat Coat Retriever) has been shedding like crazy. I thought the gloves would help slow the onslaught of fur tumbleweeds (as we call them) from forming around the house. Her dog loves these gloves! He flops on his side and revels in the soft massage. These gloves are like fur magnets.... very effective. We get a huge clumps of fur each time we use them. I highly recommend these gloves. It will not stop the shedding, but it does slow it down. It makes grooming fun and easy... and your dog will love them.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Novitch

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have a long haired grey tabby cat that sheds as he walks. I've tried all manner of brushes to keep shedding to a minimum, but nothing pulls the loose fur out. I ordered this product based on the pictures of gobs of hair it removes. When I received mine, I wet the glove as directed and..OMG! I collected enough fur to make a smoll kitten! Its been a week since I've used the glove, and the hair that used to roll around on my hardwood floors is almost non existant! My sister has a St. Bernard in her tiny house, I'm going to give her the other glove I was sent so she can be fur free too!
customer_reviews.author: K. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my Great Dane
customer_reviews.text: I read many of the reviews about short-haired dogs and most of them not getting great results. So I was a little bit hesitant but I understand that Amazon's really good about returns. These gloves worked amazing on my Great Dane! I rub down his back one time and there was hair everywhere I was able to pull it out put it in a bag and keep it going so for my short haired dog it was awesome! They were very easy to clean I pulled all the hair out and stood off with soap and water let them dry and use them again in a couple of days. It was a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Roc

customer_reviews.title: Petsitter tested and approved
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of dogsitting and since using these I can finally come home without having to lint roll a new fur coat off my pants. Pros -convenient to travel with -easy to clean (rub your hands like your cold and the fur balls up and drops off) -can finally brush those dogs that hate brushing Cons -not as effective on short hair or cats (but still an improvement in the amount of shedding!) I have watched 10 dogs since getting these and haven't had a dog who didn't love it.
customer_reviews.author: Average Jill

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves her Zoom groom but I didn't like the fact it didn't collect her shed hair very ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes! Yes! SO much Yes! My cat loves her Zoom groom but I didn't like the fact it didn't collect her shed hair very well and I ended up being completely covered in cat hair every time I groomed her. I received these gloves yesterday and my kitty couldn't get enough. I collected over 4 handfuls. The hair stayed on the gloves and not on me! The only thing I didn't like about these gloves were the Velcro wrist straps. They were uncomfortable and scratchy but I'll deal with it to keep my furbaby happy. These are definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: JerseyGal

customer_reviews.title: High quality, great for grooming and bonding!
customer_reviews.text: This product exceeded my expectations. My bunny rabbit Penelope Sussette Marlenna is a Lion's Head bunny and has a very long mane around her face and between her ears. The gloves made it easier for me and more comfortable for her to groom those areas. She loved the double glove treatment too! And I was able to remove more fur than I would with a regular pet brush. Every time I tried to stop petting her with the gloves on she would bump me with her nose to get me started again. We both love the gloves! I highly recommend them. They are great for grooming and bonding...
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: I’m a believer
customer_reviews.text: I’m not usually this eager to right a product review, but this is something I believe in, just got it an hour ago and used it and not only did it work! And the hair was fairly easy to remove and whatever I couldn’t easily remove I just shook off outside. My cat HATES getting brushed and she was actually purring and cooperative! Definitely a great buy! UPDATE- so I use them on my other cat, she is a bit more feisty to say it nicely, the last time I gave her a bath she almost bit right into my vein. She loved it! She didn’t fight me, and she didn’t bite me, it’s a success.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Gloves work well
customer_reviews.text: I recommend these gloves. The dog has no idea what I am doing, other than playing with her or petting her. The gloves gently pull out loose for. Our first day with the gloves and we filled a garbage with fur... that is not the experience we had with regular brushing. I recommend using only one glove at a time. They are difficult to remove when you have both hands gloved and strangely, two gloved hands doesn't speed the process up any faster, especially when you stop to remove fur from the glove (and can't get them off easily).
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: I cleaned dog hair off of my rug with these
customer_reviews.text: I got these absolutely NOT for what they were designed for. I have a staircase to my basement that's covered with dog hair and it's not easy to use my vacuum down there. I know from experience that rubber or rubber like materials when combined with a little moisture can squeegee up dog hair, so I figured I'd try these gloves which have the added feature of the little nubs on the palms. It took about 10 minutes and it worked very nicely. I just sat on each stair starting at the top, working my way to the bottom and collected all the hair for disposal. Heres the thing - I have not one but TWO SAMOYEDS. Nuff said?
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Levittan

customer_reviews.title: Meh, not much improvement than using your own fingers
customer_reviews.text: Meh, not much improvement than using your own fingers. My dog is Lab/shepperd mix, shedding in between seasons only. I bought these gloves to be used in addition to metal de-furing brush. Before, I would use the de-furer and then my won fingers to remove his hair, so I was hoping that having rubbery nubs on gloves will improve efficiency - it did not.The hair does come out and gets stuck in between the nubs and is hard to remove from there. Considering it's about the same efficiency as just brushing your dog with your fingers it's totally not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I just got a rescue dog that has a lot of issues. At first he was afraid of these gloves. I was able to put the gloves on without him knowing and starting petting him. He immediately calmed down and loved the feeling. He was mesmerized. The gloves fit easily and I have big hands. There is a Velcro closure but I don't need it. The gloves are well made and seem as if they will last a long time. I am especially pleased that there are two of them as a massage with both hands is what your dog / pet will love.
customer_reviews.author: OsterCharm

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the ChomChom roller!
customer_reviews.text: I used these in addition to the ChomChom Roller ( My hairy little teenage cat son just never cleans or grooms himself! We got these and brushed him and ended up removing hair that was, when balled together, an entire kitten sized ball. My chonky boi was so soft and didn't shed on everything in the house for once. The ChomChom roller was the extra bonus, it helped get all the stray hairs off of the floor, the gloves, and ME once I was done brushing him. These two items are a match made in fur-parent heaven! Highly recommend both of these, especially if your pet sheds a lot. (I am copy/pasting this review for the other product, link above)
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Buy these gloves you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves! My dog never really liked being groomed with a brush but when he sees me put these gloves and he gets so excited. They have been great at getting rid of his fur and his shedding is noticeably better. I am not kidding when I say when I would vacuum our floors they would get clogged with his hair, now after using these gloves that is not a problem. I would tell you though that the hair doesn’t necessarily stick to the gloves and it can be a little tricky to get the hair off the gloves when you are done. But overall this was an amazing purchase, highly recommend. Great for grooming a dog quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne S

customer_reviews.title: My fur babies love them
customer_reviews.text: Both my fur babies loves these gloves. It removed so much of the fallout fur easily and they both are so spoiled with them. They really like how if feels on thier coat and when I ask if they want a message they know they are about to get the gloves and sit down in front of me each waiting thier turn with the gloves. They did help so much from helping keep the fur from shedding so much.
customer_reviews.author: Leeann Elizondo

customer_reviews.title: better than a single glove
customer_reviews.text: I bought a grooming glove like these years ago - it might have been the same manufacturer. But the problem was only that it was a single right-hand version, and I had always hoped that I could find a glove for my left hand so that I could use both to "scrub" my long haired cat - with one hand moving in the opposite direction of the other. So when this pair became available I bought them, and they work as well as the original. Plenty of hair is pulled from her and it's easy to peel it off the glove faces.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Fately

customer_reviews.title: My calico is hooked!
customer_reviews.text: At first, my little shorthaired cat was not keen about these grooming gloves, but now she is a complete grooming glove addict! I usually brush her in the early evening and she starts pestering me by midafternoon. The gloves work well at removing loose fur and they're not too difficult to clean, but the velcro wrist bands are not very comfortable. They are stiff and difficult to unfasten For the money and the joy they bring to my kitty, I do recommend these grooming gloves. In fact, I bought a set for a neighbor's cat, too.
customer_reviews.author: KokoSuze

customer_reviews.title: Cats LOVE Pet Grooming Glove
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can use both hands, and my cats love, love, love the feel of the gloves and rubber nibs on their skin and fur. I wish someone would do something like this for me, but that's another story. . . Anyway, you can gather the fur with your hands, but I also use a sticky lint roller that takes it off in one sweep. (Cats also love the feel of the lint roller on their backs, and it picks up loose fur. Go figure.) Finally, I love that the grooming glove is a glove not a mitt. I can really massage my cats in all they places they love more effectively. Great product at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Leveron

customer_reviews.title: Great! Not for big hands so beware!
customer_reviews.text: Cat loved this! He was unsure at first but after he realized he's safe and I'm just brushing him he chilled and laid down and let me brush pet him. Hair does accumulate fast depending on length of fur. But if enough is on the gloves it peels off easy. But if not taking the hair off the glove can be annoying. Picking it out for a few minutes but it's worth it instead of following him around with a brush he's not fond of. The gloves also fit perfectly for my kind of medium sized hands. Bigger hands will have issue so beware that.
customer_reviews.author: Black Lilithx

customer_reviews.title: works well, some pets like it, others don't
customer_reviews.text: one of my cats really didn't like this, but the other one really likes it. Use a light touch, ofc, with a cat. I clipped off the velcro straps to make it easier to put on and remove, and to avoid the velcro noise that freaked my cats out. It does remove a fair amount of fur, and makes their coat super soft. We're heading into summer now, and every 2-3 days I get enough fur off my shorthair to make a full kitten...My long haired maine coon mutt never liked them, but he passed away, sadly. But our DSH princess really really loves these.
customer_reviews.author: FBT

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have a husky that sheds his weight in furr on what seems like a weekly basis I own a furminator brush and a few other deshedding tools but i have to say i love these gloves they may not be as effective as a furminator in removing undercoat but they are so easy to use your hands just glide over your dog picking up loose furr without snagging and hurting the dog and he really seems to enjoy the massage..... these gloves have drastically cut down the amount of time i spend grooming and sweeping my floors i highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: JMERCH

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves - but hate the color
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to finally see these gloves in a size that doesn't flop all over my hands. I wear a size 7 leather gloves and these gloves fit my hands quite well. Not sure they would be great for a large man's hand though. My cat and I both really like these. The only thing I wish they would change is the color of the gloves. My cat is a little intimidated by the blue color and I feel like a member of "Blue Man Group" every time I put them on. Other than the color I could recommend highly
customer_reviews.author: Jax01

customer_reviews.title: Big, but work great!
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that these gloves are huge for one size fits all so the fingers twist around on me when I brush my dogs. Otherwise, these work great on both my double layer coat fawn pug and my single layer coat apricot pug. It's rare for me to find a brush that works on both of them since my fawn has really stiff and wiry fur over his fluffy under fur. These gloves pick up both types of fur, and are easy to clean. The fur peels off when you get enough of it on them, and when the dander builds up you can rinse them with warm water and air dry.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Hanes

customer_reviews.title: A little awkward and messy
customer_reviews.text: My main gripe is while plenty of hair sticks to the glove, at least as much flies all over the place when I use these on my shorthair cat. It is also difficult to extract the hair from the glove by hand, except my secret is to use a little hand vac with the crevice attachment and that does a pretty good job of getting the hair off the glove without any flyaways. My cat does seem to like it, or at least like it enough to tolerate it. It does seem to get a lot more hair than just a brush.
customer_reviews.author: A. COLLEY

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: My little Shibe started blowing her puppy coat and I discovered she HATES brushes. So I decided to try these gloves out and wow I was so pleased!!! My Shiba doesn’t necessarily enjoy it, but she tolerates it. It took off all her loose fur just fine! It did take a good while to get majority of the loose fur off though, as expected. Cleaning is easy, just use your hand to rub the fur off. Rubbing glove to glove does not accomplish anything. These gloves are amazing, and I would highly recommend you try them for yourself! Especially if you have a dog who hates brushes like my dog does!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Gloves
customer_reviews.text: The gloves seem to be well made, they do remove some hair when “petting” our dog, and appear to be fairly easy to clean, and I had envisioned being able to leisurely pet and pamper our pup ... HOWEVER, our dog does not enjoy being “petted” with the gloves and spends all his time trying to bite them, thinking they’re “attacking” him, so I probably will be returning them. But if you have a calm, agreeable dog (not a 1-year-old golden retriever puppy) these gloves would most likely work very well for you.
customer_reviews.author: TEdwards

customer_reviews.title: Not a great way to groom the dog
customer_reviews.text: Using these on a Chinook, which is close in size to a lab, it does pick up fur. However getting that fur out of the glove can be next to impossible. We reverted to the rake style brush from furminator. We had the tight tooth furminator, but it was too rough on the dog. The wide tooth rake design one though is now the favorite. In between there we bought these gloves looking for an easy in between brushing the kids might like. However these gloves were dumped almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Metivier

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a joke just because I thought the concept was funny. My cat LOVES them. I’ve tried a lot of different hair brushes and they range from gentle brushes that the cat doesn’t mind to aggressive brushes that work but my cat tries to squirm away. This is the best of both worlds. It removes an absolutely incredible amount of hair and my cat actually likes it, just as much as if I were petting her normally. I would recommend this to any cat owner. Throw away your furminator or slicking tools.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Lane

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I live with two dogs and a cat. They shed like no tomorrow. I have always had trouble with the hair and allergies. These gloves are a game changer. None of the animals cared for brushing put love being petted, so I got these gloves with apprehension on how well they would work. Everyone loves them. They remove the hair and it all stays locked in one place relatively well, with then easy removal. One thing to be aware of though is the hair needs to build up for a minute before it can all be removed easily. Altogether though this is a product I would suggest you buy if you have issues with dog or cat hair.
customer_reviews.author: Momma of Many Children

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I am giving this four stars and non five is because it’s a little challenging to get the hair off the gloves. What I have found to work best is to wait till there is quite a bit of fur on them and try to peel off slowly in one big clump. My cats love the gloves and come running to get brushed when I get them out. I looks like it kind of massages them with the soft bristles on the gloves. I would recommend these gloves, much better then a standard brush.
customer_reviews.author: SusieQ

customer_reviews.title: Well-made; tolerated even by dogs that don’t like to be brushed
customer_reviews.text: I have two golden retrievers. The blonde one doesn’t like to be brushed but sheds a lot. He will, however, put up with being petted with these gloves. The other one loves to be petted under any service circumstances, so he loves them. The gloves seem to be well-made. I especially like the Velcro straps that hold them on securely. The fur actually peels off the gloves fairly easily; however, static electricity makes the gloves attract the fur. This may be worse in the winter time when the air is dry. The vacuum cleaner makes getting rid of the fur very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The cats LOVE these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 cats go crazy for these gloves!! They love these so much they try to grab them and rub themselves on it. The fur does get trapped in there while petting and it's extremely easy to take it out when you are cleaning the glove. One of our cats is very skiddish and I thought he would be scared of the glove but he loves it. Our other cat likes to be petted for a little bit and then he attacks but with this he just can't get enough of it. Highly recommend for your fur babies!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: a little rough
customer_reviews.text: Before, I purchased the pink "ENGERWALL New Upgrade Pet Grooming Glove - Gentle Pet Hair Remover Mitt & Dog Cat Deshedding Brush Glove" and I found it a pity that there was only one glove. So I purchased this pair. I find the pink one much more gentle on the cat, even though it takes more hair off and the hair is easier to remove from the (other, pink) glove. (They suggest to spray water so removing hair from the glove would be easier: I did, no change...) So, I prefer by far the other one. These blue seem to be a little rough...
customer_reviews.author: 1stella1

customer_reviews.title: My cats love these.
customer_reviews.text: I put these mitts on my hands and my two cats run towards me and fight for TLC time. After play time ends, gloves slide off easily, and all the fur that accumulated in the brush (and there's a ton) easily peels off in one layer (but do this over your garbage can). Note: there are a number of single hairs of fur that get stuck to the fabric around the plastic brush part of the gloves. I am resigned to the fact that I'll never be able to get all the hair off. My cats love these; therefore, I love these.
customer_reviews.author: N/A

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: I personally like these; the cat though. That’s a different story. It pulls the loose hair off the cat. She is scared of them. If I put them both on she runs or just tries to bite and sniff them. If I can catch her in a good mood and I only have one on I can use one hand to get the hair and she seems to like it. I have to use the other involved hand to distract her. She’s purring but she’s also confused about the sensations. I’ll keep trying to get her acclimated but they definitely work as advertised. I suppose every cat is different.
customer_reviews.author: IBuyStuffs

customer_reviews.title: So great, cats love them and run towards the sound of velcro now
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. My cats love them. I bought more pairs as presents for other cat fanciers. We've owned other brands, but I've found this set is the easiest to clean, the fingers (instead of mitten type) allow you to brush in places where the mitten is too big, like between the ears, and chin scritches. I have been really pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SoapyHollow

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as expected
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of shedding gloves in the past that worked great but these barely remove any fur. After 20 minutes of fairly strong pressure on our long-haired maine coon cat there was barely any fur to remove yet 30 seconds with a normal brush and it is completely loaded. Our cat obviously loves the extra long petting session but after many attempts to make this work, we gave up. I tried them dry, wet, and in all directions but it just does not seem to grab the fur.
customer_reviews.author: Pitstop

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: These seem to work but not on my dog. I have a Pomeranian and although this did brush the hair out, it doesn't hold on to them so they go floating around in the air. Decent quality though I updated my review. While I was initially just partially pleased with the purchase, the customer service was incredible. They discussed what issues I had and and made everything perfect. I would definitely but again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pet Grooming Glove - Gentle Deshedding Brush...
customer_reviews.text: These grooming gloves are wonderful. Better than any brush or comb that I have ever tried to use AND so easy. My long haired very fluffy dog hates to be brushed or combed. She loves these. Normally she tries to get away when I brush her or Furminate her. Our short haired not fluffy at all dog loves these. It must feel really good to them. I don't even bother to fix the velcro at the wrists. They stay on just fine. Wish I'd had these for the past several years!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: GET THESE
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I've been sleeping on these and so has everyone else. These are AMAZING. I have tried 4 different brushes on my cat and she hates them all. She never liked being brushed until I got these gloves. If I pull them out she comes running to me and will throw herself at them. She'll start purring not to mention ALL THE HAIR it gets out. She is long haired and no brush has picked up her hair like these. And it's easy to remove from the glove. I recommend these 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Desirae

customer_reviews.title: Dog favorite
customer_reviews.text: These gloves do the job. My dog loves getting groomed with them. She has a very short coat, too. I think it must be like a good overall body massage/scratch for her as she moves around to get all of her done. Easy to clean. Fits on well due to velcro strap at wrist. Good bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn McBee

customer_reviews.title: Great Grooming Product!
customer_reviews.text: We use the deshedding brush for two of our cats but for our coarse haired girl it never seems to work. These gloves do the trick very well for her. They are easy to wear and use. The price is also right! My only complaint is that unless you are brushing a lot of loose hair off of the cat so that you have a big mat of hair to pull off, the gloves are very difficult to clean. I have to run the glove under water to get the little stray hairs off.
customer_reviews.author: Silent E

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for both me and my dog!
customer_reviews.text: We have an English pointer mix (maybe with some Lab in him) who sheds a ton in the summer. Many pet brushes don't really remove the hair. The best I had found previously was a metal-toothed oval shaped brush that Toby really didn't like - I think the teeth may have hurt him. These gloves do a GREAT job removing the loose hair and Toby enjoys the rub he gets now with these gloves. They are also very easy to clean - just rinse and drip-dry. The only thing that would make them better is if they caught all the hair into a bag like a vacuum - which is certainly not feasible but wishful thinking.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Price

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for puppy
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My 4 month puppy hates getting brushed. But with these gloves, he thinks he's just getting pet. So no drama! And wow, i get way more hair with these gloves than with my brush! Super easy to use, gloves fit fine. The only problem for me is the hair is hard to remove, but thats bc its light puppy hair, and he isnt shedding as much as adult dogs yet, so removing the soft puppy hair is annoying, but still works great! And puppy enjoys the process!
customer_reviews.author: tabitha sparks

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! 5 cats and they love being petted! Gloves fit & work for whole family.
customer_reviews.text: The straps on wrist are adjustable. These gloves have more spikes than most of the other kinds of gloves I viewed. I like that. More hair is gotten this way. Works on all the cats as it makes them happy to have someone brush them. Great product! Gloves for both hands. Go to town with them on the cats. Sit where the cats can jump up next to you, and then brush away. Love me... pet me.... some more. They will be able to tolerate the hotter days now. Thanks! The best! Get these, they fit us all and no one complained.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: After reading a bunch of reviews I bought these to help groom my 2 dogs (lab and lab mix) and my long haired cat. My dogs loved being petted with these (the cat only so so). The dogs were bumping each other out of the way to get petted. They removed a ton of fur. The fur is easy to get out of the gloves (though there is a learning curve). I’m buying a second pair for my grand doggy! Would definitely buy again. Ps. The pic is from petting the dogs for only a few minutes
customer_reviews.author: cat1

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loves Her New Massage Glove!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure if my cat would like this because she attacks any brushes I’ve tried to use. She loves these gloves! It must feel good, like a massage, and it picks up a good amount of her short hair. She will even roll over for it and let me get her belly. It’s easy to get the hair off as well. Great product but probably only need 1 of them. The backside is mesh (although thick) so a claw or tooth could go through, if you’re worried about that.
customer_reviews.author: StormingShadow
